x_nuvo_diag_probes.description:
Import PI job data CSV with attribute keys that contain parenthesis or dashes will fail to import.
Steps to reproduce
1. Create a PI job with an attribute key that includes any of these characters ( - ).
2. Generate the CSV template.
3. Notice the illegal attribute key is the column header name.
4. Populate the template with data.
5. Import the CSV file.
x_nuvo_diag_probes.name: Unusable Characters
x_nuvo_diag_probes.remediation:
Remove illegal characters from attribute keys.
Generate a new CSV template.
Populate the CSV with data.
Import the CSV.

sys_update_version.name: x_nuvo_diag_probes_44a7c4d01b7c9150ae5b21b5ec4bcb50

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update table="x_nuvo_diag_probes"><x_nuvo_diag_probes action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"><active>false</active><description>Import PI job data CSV with attribute keys that contain parenthesis or dashes will fail to import.

Steps to reproduce

1. Create a PI job with an attribute key that includes any of these characters ( - ).

2. Generate the CSV template.

3. Notice the illegal attribute key is the column header name.

4. Populate the template with data.

5. Import the CSV file.</description><name>Unusable Characters</name><order/><probe_type display_value="Physical Inventory">86f2c5091bac1510ae5b21b5ec4bcb62</probe_type><remediation>Remove illegal characters from attribute keys.

Generate a new CSV template.

Populate the CSV with data.

Import the CSV.</remediation><script><![CDATA[//This issue is not reproducible
var util = new x_nuvo_diag.DiagnosticUtil();
util.handleOutput('Please remove the illegal characters(-) from the attribute keys and then generate a new CSV template. Populate the CSV with data and Import the CSV. You can check the import log and confirm that the import has been done successfully.
